column4: Hey! I am trying to run a SUDO command but i always came with `command not found`. can someone help?
"Command not found" is referint to the command, (not sudo).
Again, it is not sudo it is complaining about, it is the command you are using sudo to execute.  (Read what it says.)
I'm sorry.  Waht is your question?
i am just trying to run this simple sudo command

What the error message is telling you that omap_usbload is not a command.  Now if it is a script or some sort of executable and you want to run it, you will more-than-likely need to set the executable bit on it.  i.e. chmood +x omap3_usbload
But be sure it is going to do something you really want it to do before you set the executable bit and run it.
Did you read and follow the instructions on the URL you posted above?
i followed the steps over there and come to sudo step last
Are you sure you did exactly as it said?
we came to an end with no success again?
